abstract.text: A description of a long short-term memory block or layer.

inlineContent.text: The recurrent neural network (RNN) layer initialized with

transforms the input data (image or matrix), the memory cell data, and previous output with a set of filters. Each produces one feature map in the output data and memory cell according to the long short-term memory (LSTM) formula detailed below.
You may provide the LSTM unit with a single input or a sequence of inputs.
be the input data (at time index
be the recurrent input (previous output) data from previous time step (at time index
be the output data produced at this time step.
be the previous memory cell data (at time index
be the new memory cell data (at time index
be the input gate weights for input, recurrent input, and memory cell (peephole) data, respectively.
be the bias for the input gate.
be the forget gate weights for input, recurrent input, and memory cell data, respectively.
be the bias for the forget gate.
be the output gate weights for input, recurrent input, and memory cell data, respectively.
be the bias for the output gate.
be the memory cell gate weights for input, recurrent input, and memory cell data, respectively.
be the bias for the memory cell gate.
be the neuron activation function for the input, forget, output gate, and memory cell gate.
be the activation function applied to result memory cell data.
The output of the LSTM layer is computed as follows:

code: I_i = gi(  Wi_ij * x_j  +  Ui_ij * h0_j  +  Vi_ij * c0_j  + bi_i  )
F_i = gf(  Wf_ij * x_j  +  Uf_ij * h0_j  +  Vf_ij * c0_j  + bf_i  )
C_i = gc(  Wc_ij * x_j  +  Uc_ij * h0_j  +  Vc_ij * c0_j  + bc_i  )
O_i = go(  Wo_ij * x_j  +  Uo_ij * h0_j  +  Vo_ij * c1_j  + bo_i  )

inlineContent.text: (except for the batch index), but there's no summation over repeated index
Note that for validity, all intermediate images must be of same size, and all
). Also, the bias terms are scalars with regard to spatial dimensions.

abstract.text: The protocol that provides convolution filter weights and bias terms.
